children.text: Okay, I need to translate these three Java programs into a single Fortran program that does the same thing as the sequence.

children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: The fine is the sum of combinations of 2 for each column and row where there are at least two Cs. So for each column, count the Cs, then add (count choose 2) to the total. Same for each row.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: The second program (atcoder_ABC051_A) takes a string input, replaces commas with spaces, and outputs it.

! Columns processing
do i = 1, num  ! column index

            counter = counter +1
        end if
    end do

end do

! Rows processing

children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Third program's processing:

Compute the minimal sum of digit sums. First, define a function sum_digits(a) that returns the sum of digits of a.

FUNCTION sum_digits(a) RESULT(res)
    integer, intent(in) :: a
    integer :: res, ans, temp
    ans =0
    temp = a
    do while (temp >=10)
        ans = ans + mod(temp,10)
        temp = temp /10
    end do
    ans = ans + temp
    res = ans
END FUNCTION sum_digits

Then, compute N as above. Then compute the third program's logic:

if N is even, n = N/2 else n = (N+1)/2

ans is initialized to sum_digits(1) + sum_digits(N-1)

then loop A from 1 to n:

    current_sum = sum_digits(A) + sum_digits(N - A)

    if current_sum < ans, then ans = current_sum

Finally, output ans.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Putting it all together:

After computing N, proceed:

! Third program's processing
integer :: n, current_sum, ans_third, A
ans_third = sum_digits(1) + sum_digits(N -1)
n = N/2
if (mod(N,2) ==1) then
    n = (N+1)/2
end if
do A =1, n
    current_sum = sum_digits(A) + sum_digits(N - A)
    if (current_sum < ans_third) then
        ans_third = current_sum
    end if
end do

Finally, print ans_third.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Putting all together in the program:

Now, putting all steps into the Fortran program.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: Wait, but in Fortran, functions must be declared before use. So the sum_digits function should be placed before the main program.
children.label: bug_fixing

children.text: Alternatively, use an internal function or a module.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: Alternatively, write the function inside the main program.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Wait, in Fortran, functions can be inside the main program. So here's the full code outline:

program main
    implicit none
    integer :: num, fine, N, ans_third, A, i, k, counter
    character(len=20) :: temp_str
    character(len=100), allocatable :: arr(:)
    
    !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Read input
    read(*,*) num
    allocate(arr(num)) do i = 1, num
        read(*, '(a)') arr(i)
    end do
    
    ! Compute first program's fine
    fine =0
    ! Columns
    do i =1, num
        counter =0
        do k =1, num
            if (arr(k)(i:i) == 'C') then
                counter = counter +1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + (counter * (counter -1)) /2
    end do
    
    ! Rows
    do i =1, num
        counter =0
        do k =1, num
            if (arr(i)(k:k) == 'C') then
                counter = counter +1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + (counter * (counter -1))/2
    end do
    
    ! Second program's processing
    write(temp_str, '(i0)') fine
    ! Replace commas with spaces
    integer :: len
    len = len_trim(temp_str) do i =1, len
        if (temp_str(i:i) == ',') then
            temp_str(i:i) = ' '
        end if
    end do
    read(temp_str, '(i0)') N
    
    ! Third program's processing
    integer :: ans_third, current_sum, n
    ans_third = sum_digits(1) + sum_digits(N -1)
    n = N/2
    if (mod(N,2) ==1) then
        n = (N+1)/2
    end if
    do A =1, n
        current_sum = sum_digits(A) + sum_digits(N - A) if (current_sum < ans_third) then
            ans_third = current_sum
        end if
    end do
    
    print*, ans_third
    
contains
    integer function sum_digits(a)
        integer, intent(in) :: a
        integer :: ans, temp
        ans =0
        temp = a
        do while (temp >=10)
            ans = ans + mod(temp,10)
            temp = temp /10
        end do
        ans = ans + temp
        sum_digits = ans
    end function sum_digits
end program main

So in code:

! Columns processing
do i = 1, num  ! column index
    counter =0
    do k = 1, num  ! row index
        if (arr(k)(i:i) == 'C') then
            counter = counter +1
        end if
    end do
    fine = fine + (counter * (counter -1)) /2
end do

! Rows processing
do i = 1, num  ! row index
    counter =0
    do k = 1, num  ! column index
        if (arr(i)(k:k) == 'C') then
            counter = counter +1
        end if
    end do

Yes, that should work.

Next, the second program's processing: take the fine (integer), convert to a string, replace commas with spaces, then convert back to integer N.

In Fortran, converting integer to string can be done with write and read.

First, convert fine to a string:

Then, replace any commas with spaces. Since in the string representation of an integer, there are no commas (unless in some locales, but assuming standard), so the string remains the same.

read(temp_str, '(i0)') N

! Second program's processing
write(temp_str, '(i0)') fine
! Replace commas with spaces. Since there are none, but to do it:

! Now convert back to N

Third program's processing:

Compute the minimal sum of digit sums.

First, define a function sum_digits(a) that returns the sum of digits of a.

FUNCTION sum_digits(a) RESULT(res)
    integer, intent(in) :: a
    integer :: res, ans, temp
    ans =0
    temp = a
    do while (temp >=10)
        ans = ans + mod(temp,10)
        temp = temp /10
    end do
    ans = ans + temp
    res = ans
END FUNCTION sum_digits

Then, compute N as above.

Then compute the third program's logic:

if N is even, n = N/2 else n = (N+1)/2

ans is initialized to sum_digits(1) + sum_digits(N-1)

then loop A from 1 to n:

    current_sum = sum_digits(A) + sum_digits(N - A)

    if current_sum < ans, then ans = current_sum

Finally, output ans.

Putting it all together:

After computing N, proceed:

! Third program's processing
integer :: n, current_sum, ans_third, A
ans_third = sum_digits(1) + sum_digits(N -1)
n = N/2
if (mod(N,2) ==1) then
    n = (N+1)/2
end if
do A =1, n
    current_sum = sum_digits(A) + sum_digits(N - A)
    if (current_sum < ans_third) then
        ans_third = current_sum
    end if
end do

Finally, print ans_third.

Putting all together in the program:

Now, putting all steps into the Fortran program.

Wait, but in Fortran, functions must be declared before use. So the sum_digits function should be placed before the main program.

Alternatively, use an internal function or a module. Since this is a single program, perhaps an internal function.

Alternatively, write the function inside the main program.

Wait, in Fortran, functions can be inside the main program.

So here's the full code outline:

program main
    implicit none
    integer :: num, fine, N, ans_third, A, i, k, counter
    character(len=20) :: temp_str
    character(len=100), allocatable :: arr(:)
    
    ! Read input
    read(*,*) num
    allocate(arr(num))
    do i = 1, num
        read(*, '(a)') arr(i)
    end do
    
    ! Compute first program's fine
    fine =0
    ! Columns
    do i =1, num
        counter =0
        do k =1, num
            if (arr(k)(i:i) == 'C') then
                counter = counter +1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + (counter * (counter -1)) /2
    end do
    
    ! Rows
    do i =1, num
        counter =0
        do k =1, num
            if (arr(i)(k:k) == 'C') then
                counter = counter +1
            end if
        end do
        fine = fine + (counter * (counter -1))/2
    end do
    
    ! Second program's processing
    write(temp_str, '(i0)') fine
    ! Replace commas with spaces
    integer :: len
    len = len_trim(temp_str)
    do i =1, len
        if (temp_str(i:i) == ',') then
            temp_str(i:i) = ' '
        end if
    end do
    read(temp_str, '(i0)') N
    
    ! Third program's processing
    integer :: ans_third, current_sum, n
    ans_third = sum_digits(1) + sum_digits(N -1)
    n = N/2
    if (mod(N,2) ==1) then
        n = (N+1)/2
    end if
    do A =1, n
        current_sum = sum_digits(A) + sum_digits(N - A)
        if (current_sum < ans_third) then
            ans_third = current_sum
        end if
    end do
    
    print*, ans_third
    
contains
    integer function sum_digits(a)
        integer, intent(in) :: a
        integer :: ans, temp
        ans =0
        temp = a
        do while (temp >=10)
            ans = ans + mod(temp,10)
            temp = temp /10
        end do
        ans = ans + temp
        sum_digits = ans
    end function sum_digits
end program main
